KH.content: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]
KH.linkedContent: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]

KH.content: is Socrates someone, something, play of proper names more abyssal than ever, “who are you, Khōra?”
KH.linkedContent: is Socrates someone, something, play of proper names more abyssal than ever, “who are you, Khōra?”

KH.content: oral maze inscribed in place which receives everything, Timaeus, addressed to “the one who, as we do, and before us [see p. 117], receives everything,” in this theory of receptions—Socrates
KH.linkedContent: oral maze inscribed in place which receives everything, Timaeus, addressed to “the one who, as we do, and before us [see p. 117], receives everything,” in this theory of receptions—Socrates

GOD.content: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)
GOD.linkedContent: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)

FK.content: descent of God ex machina, stage a “transcendental addressing machine”
FK.linkedContent: descent of God ex machina, stage a “transcendental addressing machine”

FK.content: one either responds to an address with absolute faith or reacts resentfully, impossible to tell which is the response, due to one contaminating the other
FK.linkedContent: one either responds to an address with absolute faith or reacts resentfully, impossible to tell which is the response, due to one contaminating the other

FK.content: “without the performative experience of this elementary act of faith, there would neither be ‘social bond’ nor address of the other, nor performativity in general”
FK.linkedContent: “without the performative experience of this elementary act of faith, there would neither be ‘social bond’ nor address of the other, nor performativity in general”

FL.content: justice addresses itself to the singularity of the other, despite or because it pretends toward universality [?]
FL.linkedContent: justice addresses itself to the singularity of the other, despite or because it pretends toward universality [?]

MC.content: I address you w/out knowing you, something arrives [Nietzsche’s future philosophers]
MC.linkedContent: I address you w/out knowing you, something arrives [Nietzsche’s future philosophers]

H.content: [on Oedipus’ final mourning] he’s deprived of something in secrecy [of light?], an encrypting of encrypting, in the crypt the address is cryptic
H.linkedContent: [on Oedipus’ final mourning] he’s deprived of something in secrecy [of light?], an encrypting of encrypting, in the crypt the address is cryptic

H.content: Theseus, with Oedipus’ burial secret, becomes a retained hostage, a detained addressee
H.linkedContent: Theseus, with Oedipus’ burial secret, becomes a retained hostage, a detained addressee

H.content: everyone is hostage to the dead man (Oedipus)
H.linkedContent: everyone is hostage to the dead man (Oedipus)

H.content: absolute, hyperbolical, unconditional hospitality suspends language, a particular determinant one, and even the address to the other
H.linkedContent: absolute, hyperbolical, unconditional hospitality suspends language, a particular determinant one, and even the address to the other

SPOM.content: the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)
SPOM.linkedContent: the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)

SPOM.content: Marcellus anticipated la venue d’un autre scholar, had to wait several centuries [for Derrida], one who can think possibility of specter, specter as possibility, who can address spirits, who knows that such is the condition of address, mad enough to unlock such a possibility
SPOM.linkedContent: Marcellus anticipated la venue d’un autre scholar, had to wait several centuries [for Derrida], one who can think possibility of specter, specter as possibility, who can address spirits, who knows that such is the condition of address, mad enough to unlock such a possibility

SPOM.content: I accepted address (invitation) “so as not to flee from a responsibility”
SPOM.linkedContent: I accepted address (invitation) “so as not to flee from a responsibility”

HERP.content: acc. Aristotle, there must be presence in act of friendship > can exhaust itself in non-address, immediate non-hailing (non-interpellation) [does Heidegger agree? see p. 176]
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Aristotle, there must be presence in act of friendship > can exhaust itself in non-address, immediate non-hailing (non-interpellation) [does Heidegger agree? see p. 176]

HASD.content: unique address of khora is not a prayer, a celebration, or an encomium, does not speak to You
HASD.linkedContent: unique address of khora is not a prayer, a celebration, or an encomium, does not speak to You

PAS.content: cette femme, not yours, but the name for you, not a part of you, doesn’t possess you, addresses you > [she responds?] my name is unique, and you hide it, forget it
PAS.linkedContent: cette femme, not yours, but the name for you, not a part of you, doesn’t possess you, addresses you > [she responds?] my name is unique, and you hide it, forget it

POOF.content: “O my friends, there is no friend”—an address > faire appel, prendre appel
POOF.linkedContent: “O my friends, there is no friend”—an address > faire appel, prendre appel

POOF.content: limit is also a chance: must receive address of other at particular address, in singular language
POOF.linkedContent: limit is also a chance: must receive address of other at particular address, in singular language

POOF.content: every instant begins at the end, address carries in its readability the signature of the addressee: it withdraws from space by penetrating it
POOF.linkedContent: every instant begins at the end, address carries in its readability the signature of the addressee: it withdraws from space by penetrating it

POOF.content: Aristotle’s ‘O my friends, no friends’: a last will & testament, spoken from place of death, does not address enemies (unlike Nietzsche's living fool) > dying person turns toward friendship, living person towards enmity
POOF.linkedContent: Aristotle’s ‘O my friends, no friends’: a last will & testament, spoken from place of death, does not address enemies (unlike Nietzsche's living fool) > dying person turns toward friendship, living person towards enmity

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s address ‘Foes, there are no foes’ requests that we go beyond excuse & pardon, still moves in religious space of benediction or malediction?
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s address ‘Foes, there are no foes’ requests that we go beyond excuse & pardon, still moves in religious space of benediction or malediction?

POOF.content: Nietzsche refers to his friends as brothers (all of Zarathustra read through this figural alignment) > addressees lay down law of genre, so their coming virtues are virile ones
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche refers to his friends as brothers (all of Zarathustra read through this figural alignment) > addressees lay down law of genre, so their coming virtues are virile ones

POOF.content: that either address [re: omega ω] is addressed to someone will always expose utterance to undecidability because address to ‘someone’ presupposes the impossible: 1) neutral gender 2) ‘only one’ someone > for one person to receive a mark once, the mark must multiply, its iterability affirms plus d’un (which allows & limits calculability), the 3rd party is there > there is never one, one is always more than one (w/ or w/out consent)
POOF.linkedContent: that either address [re: omega ω] is addressed to someone will always expose utterance to undecidability because address to ‘someone’ presupposes the impossible: 1) neutral gender 2) ‘only one’ someone > for one person to receive a mark once, the mark must multiply, its iterability affirms plus d’un (which allows & limits calculability), the 3rd party is there > there is never one, one is always more than one (w/ or w/out consent)

SEC.content: absence—death of addressee (inscribed in mark) > value or effect of transcendentality linked to possibility of writing, to this “death”
SEC.linkedContent: absence—death of addressee (inscribed in mark) > value or effect of transcendentality linked to possibility of writing, to this “death”

SEC.content: what holds for addressee, holds for sender, holds for scribe, holds for reader (disappearance)
SEC.linkedContent: what holds for addressee, holds for sender, holds for scribe, holds for reader (disappearance)

SH.content: “caesura is the law”: gathers in the discretion of the discontinuous, in the cutting in of relation to other, interruption of address as address itself
SH.linkedContent: “caesura is the law”: gathers in the discretion of the discontinuous, in the cutting in of relation to other, interruption of address as address itself

SH.content: partage (imparting, division): remarked at point of departure, address to other
SH.linkedContent: partage (imparting, division): remarked at point of departure, address to other

SH.content: “you” may be addressed to the other as well as to myself, to oneself as other [“you” listening Sagi?]
SH.linkedContent: “you” may be addressed to the other as well as to myself, to oneself as other [“you” listening Sagi?]

OTO.content: mother is the faceless figure of a figurant, an extra, gives rise to all figures by becoming anonymous, everything addresses/destines itself to her, she survives, as long she’s at bottom
OTO.linkedContent: mother is the faceless figure of a figurant, an extra, gives rise to all figures by becoming anonymous, everything addresses/destines itself to her, she survives, as long she’s at bottom

ATIA.content: Kant, Heidegger, Lacan, Levinas, Descartes, all men, all belong to quasi-epochal category: never been seen (naked) by an animal, never imagine animal could address them > Derrida believes they all have, must decipher symptom of this disavowal
ATIA.linkedContent: Kant, Heidegger, Lacan, Levinas, Descartes, all men, all belong to quasi-epochal category: never been seen (naked) by an animal, never imagine animal could address them > Derrida believes they all have, must decipher symptom of this disavowal

ATIA.content: only poets/prophets face address of the animal, not juridical, civil men
ATIA.linkedContent: only poets/prophets face address of the animal, not juridical, civil men

ATIA.content: time before time has always made “me” dizzy: God’s exposure to surprise, when God does not know what will become, what will happen when the poet names living things; Derrida feels the same way, depuis le temps, before his cat: will it/God address me?
ATIA.linkedContent: time before time has always made “me” dizzy: God’s exposure to surprise, when God does not know what will become, what will happen when the poet names living things; Derrida feels the same way, depuis le temps, before his cat: will it/God address me?

SW.content: letting other live: absolute suicide, no trace, not even the seal of a break
SW.linkedContent: letting other live: absolute suicide, no trace, not even the seal of a break

SW.content: not even leave them my ashes
SW.linkedContent: not even leave them my ashes

SW.content: no longer be oneself or have oneself (s’être ou s’avoir) > truth w/out truth looking for me at end of world
SW.linkedContent: no longer be oneself or have oneself (s’être ou s’avoir) > truth w/out truth looking for me at end of world

SW.content: blessing of one who leaves w/out leaving an address
SW.linkedContent: blessing of one who leaves w/out leaving an address

DPi.content: Hugo (on French Revolution): once there’s peace, no more DP > Hugo: “inviolability of  human life” > [Hugo aware of rhetoric of address, of apostrophe]
DPi.linkedContent: Hugo (on French Revolution): once there’s peace, no more DP > Hugo: “inviolability of human life” > [Hugo aware of rhetoric of address, of apostrophe]

RGE.content: Bataille addresses total renunciation to the least weak [see quote]
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille addresses total renunciation to the least weak [see quote]

TR.content: a necessity of solitude, no intuition of alter ego felt by addresser & addressee [on either side of excuse/apology/forgiveness]
TR.linkedContent: a necessity of solitude, no intuition of alter ego felt by addresser & addressee [on either side of excuse/apology/forgiveness]

EL.content: the one who confesses (accuses, announces, cautions, warns) does not exclude himself from the whole (ensemble) of his addressees > to speak to the blind: this is act of confession
EL.linkedContent: the one who confesses (accuses, announces, cautions, warns) does not exclude himself from the whole (ensemble) of his addressees > to speak to the blind: this is act of confession

HST.content: an example is always a substitutable substitute > “you, for example” often  violent address of one who has power/authority to take hostage: inscribes possible replaceability in address to other
HST.linkedContent: an example is always a substitutable substitute > “you, for example” often violent address of one who has power/authority to take hostage: inscribes possible replaceability in address to other

TN.content: se toucher toi, “Je se touche”; “tu” [in philosophical discourse] signs general/plural singularity of possible addressee, also signs possibility/need for “I” to address itself as an other > oneself: first & last other
TN.linkedContent: se toucher toi, “Je se touche”; “tu” [in philosophical discourse] signs general/plural singularity of possible addressee, also signs possibility/need for “I” to address itself as an other > oneself: first & last other

TN.content: for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”
TN.linkedContent: for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”

TN.content: dissymmetry of se toucher toi makes “you” the touchable (untouchable) pole of an apostrophizing address
TN.linkedContent: dissymmetry of se toucher toi makes “you” the touchable (untouchable) pole of an apostrophizing address

BSi.content: “after you”: my first address to other as other
BSi.linkedContent: “after you”: my first address to other as other

BSi.content: Celan: poem needs the other, reaches, searches, addresses the other
BSi.linkedContent: Celan: poem needs the other, reaches, searches, addresses the other

UWC.content: [the event, the unconditional] matter of the sense of sense [meaning of meaning?] > up to you now, up to others—signatories are also addressees
UWC.linkedContent: [the event, the unconditional] matter of the sense of sense [meaning of meaning?] > up to you now, up to others—signatories are also addressees

SPEC.content: demon, revenance which repeats its entrance, revient w/out having been called by PP > like Socrates’ demon, which made everyone write, this automaton produces effects of ventriloquism, w/out origin, emission, addressee, tele w/out telos
SPEC.linkedContent: demon, revenance which repeats its entrance, revient w/out having been called by PP > like Socrates’ demon, which made everyone write, this automaton produces effects of ventriloquism, w/out origin, emission, addressee, tele w/out telos

FV.content: for Lacan, [proper] address of letter: law that binds King & Queen
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, [proper] address of letter: law that binds King & Queen

FV.content: there are only ostriches, the more one presents one’s rear, the more one is master: can’t avoid being plucked (laisser plumer)
FV.linkedContent: there are only ostriches, the more one presents one’s rear, the more one is master: can’t avoid being plucked (laisser plumer)
